item.title: vim-expand, my second {plugin,bundle}!
item.dc:creator: Oliver Caldwell
item.description: So I just pushed up my second ever Vim plugin, vim-expand. It allows you to expand things like {foo,bar}, {1..10} and $HOME inline with a single command. It’s not just limited to single lines though, you can also execute it on a visual range! Here’s a quick video of it in action. There’s way more […]
item.content:encoded:
So I just pushed up my second ever Vim plugin, vim-expand. It allows you to expand things like {foo,bar}, {1..10} and $HOME inline with a single command. It’s not just limited to single lines though, you can also execute it on a visual range! Here’s a quick video of it in action.

There’s way more information in the repository, so have a read through that. I hope it comes in useful for others some day, it’s been useful for me a few times already!
